1.label: ANATOMICAL_REGION
sentence: Single neurons in areas such as the prefrontal cortex (PFC) show complex heterogeneous tuning to multiple task variables
We find similar suppression of irrelevant sensory responses in the prefrontal cortex of monkeys performing the same task
remarks: Key brain region studied in context-dependent decision-making
Alignment confirmed via UBERON ontology
Perfect match with ontology label and context
1.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks

2.label: ANIMAL_SPECIES
sentence: The dataset consists of several hundred PFC neurons (n = 727 and 574 for monkeys A and F, respectively) recorded from two rhesus monkeys performing a context-dependent decision-making task
remarks: Experimental subjects in the study
Alignment confirmed via NCBI Taxonomy
High confidence alignment, though common name differs from scientific name
2.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks

3.label: CELL_TYPE
sentence: These computations result from interactions between excitatory and inhibitory neurons in cortical circuits
The RNN consists of 50 recurrently connected units, 40 excitatory and 10 inhibitory
remarks: Key neural population in cortical circuits
Alignment confirmed via Cell Ontology
Good match, though second instance refers to model units rather than biological neurons

sentence: These computations result from interactions between excitatory and inhibitory neurons in cortical circuits
The RNN consists of 50 recurrently connected units, 40 excitatory and 10 inhibitory

5.label: EXPERIMENTAL_PARADIGM
sentence: We apply the latent circuit inference to recurrent neural networks trained to perform a context-dependent decision-making task
We analyzed a publicly available dataset of neural activity recordings from the PFC of two monkeys performing a context-dependent decision-making task
remarks: Core cognitive task studied in the paper
No direct ontology term available
Good contextual description despite lack of formal ontology alignment
5.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks

6.label: COMPUTATIONAL_MODEL
sentence: Similar heterogeneous responses emerge in high-dimensional recurrent neural network (RNN) models trained to perform cognitive tasks
We apply the latent circuit inference to recurrent neural networks (RNNs) optimized on a context-dependent decision-making task
remarks: Primary computational model used in the study
No direct ontology term available
Clear description of model type in context
6.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks

7.label: COMPUTATIONAL_MODEL
sentence: We develop the latent circuit model, a dimensionality reduction approach in which task variables interact via low-dimensional recurrent connectivity to produce behavioral output
The latent circuit model captures task-related neural activity in the low-dimensional subspace spanned by the columns of Q
remarks: Novel computational approach developed in this study
No direct ontology term available
Excellent description of model purpose and function
7.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks

8.label: ACTIVATION_FUNCTION
sentence: The latent nodes interact via the recurrent connectivity wrec and receive external task inputs u through the input connectivity win: ̇x = −x + f(wrecx + winu), where f is a rectified linear (ReLU) activation function
remarks: Nonlinear activation function used in the latent circuit model
No direct ontology term available
Clear technical description with mathematical context
8.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks

9.label: COMPUTATIONAL_TOOL
sentence: We perform this minimization using PyTorch and the Adam optimizer with default values 0.9 and 0.999 for the decay rate of the first and second moment estimates
remarks: Deep learning framework used for model optimization
No direct ontology term available
Well-known tool in computational neuroscience
9.paper_title: Latent circuit inference from heterogeneous neural responses during cognitive tasks
